roleset.name: give, cause to have (as profit)
roleset.note: NET-V NOTES: Frames file for 'net' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No Verbnet entry. Comparison to 'total'. (from net.02-v predicate notes)
NETTING-N NOTES: Added by Julia for EWT.

example.name: net-v: ditransitive
example.text: He took the company public in an offering that *trace* netted Applied about $12.6 million, which helped launch the company's acquisition program.

example.name: netting-n
example.text: When they do net, more often than not their netting is limited to close-out provisions

roleset.name: get
roleset.note: NET-V NOTES: Frames file for 'net' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No Verbnet entry. Comparison to 'total'. (from net.03-v predicate notes)

example.name: the one that got away
example.text: Yet although California Plant Protection was netting bigger and bigger clients -- the firm provided security for the 1984 Summer Olympics in Los Angeles -- it still didn't have the name recognition of Pinkerton's.
example.arg: the firm provided security for the 1984 Summer Olympics in Los Angeles

example.name: add it up
example.text: That nets out to about $17 a share for the company on a private market basis.
